user_message:
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. Here is the code of dir_reader: ```c static ssize_t dir_reader (void *cls, uint64_t pos, char *buf, size_t max) { DIR *dir = cls; struct dirent *e; int res; if (max < 512) return 0; (void) pos; /* 'pos' is ignored as function return next one single entry per call. */ do { e = readdir (dir); if (e == NULL) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_OF_STREAM; } while (e->d_name[0] == '.'); res = snprintf (buf, max, "%s
", e->d_name, e->d_name); if (0 >= res) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR; if (max < (size_t) res) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR; return (ssize_t) res; } ``` Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function dir_reader: #define MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_OF_STREAM ((ssize_t)-1) ... #define MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR ((ssize_t)-2) Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze: ```c res = snprintf (buf, max, "%s
", e->d_name, e->d_name); ``` Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
scenario: No violation: the snprintf call is reachable when the function continues past the early return (max >= 512) and readdir returns a non-NULL entry that is not a dot entry. There is no code path that makes the snprintf invocation unreachable, so MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is not violated for this fragment.
